description.narrative: Increasing clean energy production: The project will directly contribute to increase the country''s generation from renewable energy sources and to meet the Renewable Purchase Obligation (RPO) of the state of Madhya Pradesh. The project is expected to generate up to 330GWh from 2018 which corresponds to approximately 0.3 million individual residential people reached. Climate Change Mitigation: IFC''s investment will enable clean energy production that will help avoid GHG emissions, of approximately 268,144 tons of CO2 equivalent emissions per year beginning in 2015. Employment generation: The Project will provide employment for 40 direct employees during operations. Introduction of High Environmental, Social, Health and Safety Standards: IFC is working closely with the Companies to establish an environmental management system in line with IFC''s Performance Standards.

The Project involves development of two wind farms with a combined capacity of 170 MW in the low income state of Madhya Pradesh in India by Surajbari Windfarm Development Pvt Ltd (SWDPL or the Sponsor) through its two wholly owned subsidiaries, DJ Energy Private Limited and Uttar Urja Projects Private Limited (DJEPL and UUPPL respectively or the Companies). SWDPL has a successful track record of implementing wind power projects in India. It has about 127MW capacity under operation in the state of Gujarat and Maharashtra and another 115MW project is under construction in Maharashtra. The off taker for the Project will be MP Power Management Company Limited, a state owned utility.
